name: (1E)-N,N'-bis(4-methylphenyl)-2-[(4-methylphenyl)amino]ethanimidamide
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-3193
Reason: 1-ethylpiperazine base, with a melting point around 106 degrees Celsius. The methylphenyl group introduces a rigid structure, which can participate in dipole interactions and raise the melting point by approximately +10 degrees Celsius. The methyl group also introduces a slight increase in molecular weight and van der Waals interactions, estimated at around +2 degrees Celsius. The amino group introduces additional rigid structures that can participate in dipole interactions and raise the melting point by approximately +5 degrees Celsius. The piperidine ring introduces additional rigid structures that can participate in dipole interactions and raise the melting point by approximately +5 degrees Celsius. The methylene bridge introduces additional rigid structures that can participate in dipole interactions and raise the melting point by approximately +2 degrees Celsius. The presence of two phenyl groups can significantly increase the melting point due to the increase in molecular weight and van der Waals interactions, estimated at approximately +20 degrees Celsius each.
